website_summaries.verdict: Not only is this rake made by a trusted brand, but it offers the design and durability to last and tackle numerous landscape chores.
pros: A rugged landscape rake with a 36-inch head
Steady handle and strong tines are suitable for clearing out various items from landscaping
Also practical for positioning stones, mulch, and more
cons: A few customers griped about missing screws or misaligned pre-drilled holes

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to assemble. It's light. The aluminum head is very sturdy. Easily sifts stones out of loose soil. Use it to level our backyard after clearing an ivy patch and a pachysandra patch. Worked extremely well. Also the price was nearly half compared to other landscape rakes.
customer_reviews.author: Prakash

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit and finish, utterly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface my comments with this. I will go out of my way to buy American Made products. I could‘ve just as easily gone to the Home Cheapo and bought a Chinese rake for less $. When I unpacked the rake, I found the rake end to be covered in oil and aluminum shavings from when it was stamped. Also, due to the sloppy stamp job, razor sharp jagged edges are on almost all of the teeth. I am disgusted with what I’ve spent my money on. I will not be buying any more products from this manufacturer, nor will I recommend their products to anyone. I hope this review makes it to them. Utterly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: HVAC-4-ME

customer_reviews.title: Great for a new lawn prep or old lawn makeover!
customer_reviews.text: The final results seem to be very pleasing, in terms evening out the soil for our yard makeover. It was good at removing small debris as well. We first used a bow rake to get rid of the bigger rocks and clumps. Then we went over the ground with this rake, and it was easy to see and fix the high and low spots in the yard. It is worth the money, as it is a very well made rake.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Zan

customer_reviews.title: Use it both with tines down and up
customer_reviews.text: At first I wondered how effective this would be because it's so light. Well, with 10 tons of 1/2 inch gravel partly spread on my 150 foot driveway by the local gravel yard, I quickly got to work with this rake. With the tines down, as shown in the photo, it doesn't pull a lot of gravel. However with the tines up, it pushes a lot of material. I alternated between pulling and pushing, and after four hours of work, I'd leveled out the gravel and started receiving compliments from the neighbor!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: It works well - Thank you
customer_reviews.text: I like this item a lot. I did my back yard, bought top soil and used a regular 12” rake I had in the garage to spread it with. A few days later I found several low areas. With the frequent rain we’ve been having this season, the soil was always muddy. I bought myself a tiller and redid the whole backyard once we got a break with the rain. I then used this rake and I could see the wonderful results as I spread the soil. Just like magic. Hope it lasts forever. Seems to be made of good materials.
customer_reviews.author: P’atak

customer_reviews.title: Hardworking beast
customer_reviews.text: Invaluable tool for big landscape projects. So lightweight and easy to use. It makes moving large amounts of soil/mulch much less strenuous. I accidentally threw the instructions away and was a little frustrated trying to assemble it. Just know that the bolts don’t tighten down all the way and that this is by design. I love this rake!
customer_reviews.author: Serious About Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Supplier shipped me the wrong size rake Ordered 36" and received 30" rake
customer_reviews.text: I like the rake and its design. I received it and put it together. A very sturdy design, but then I started thinking it seemed a little short. I measured my rake. It measures 30 inches wide. I thought I had ordered a 36 inch wide rake. I then rechecked my order and discovered yes, I ordered a 36 and the one shipped to me was a 30. THAT IS WHY I GAVE THE OVERALL LOW RATING. VERY BAD SERVICE FROM THE SUPPLIER. Already broke down the box for recycling and just will be more cautious in the future about checking sizes, etc when I receive them.
customer_reviews.author: Allen99

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: This product took an hour to assemble😖 The hole in the handle didn’t align and I had to get a friend to re-drill the hole. If I didn’t need it so badly I would have returned the rake. I would purchase this rake at Home Depot next time. I had purchased one about 25 years ago and left it in another state.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Alfery

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for cleaning up the beach and raking up the leaves and needles
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Krueger

customer_reviews.title: But this one and don’t look back🌎
customer_reviews.text: Bought a similar version from BBS and the rings bent after one use. Immediately ordered this to compare and it did not disappoint in anyway. Highly recommend Tough, light, effective and efficient. Update: We love and work in the Desert whee the ground has bedrock and weed barriers everywhere. Zero scape landscaping is the norm and after beating this through the dirt with a good amount of force numerous times, it’s hardened and tempered blades are straight as an arrow. Still kicks ass⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ This rake kicks ass 😎🚀
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Varn Harper

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and sturdy; Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: This rake was bought for leveling our new lawn before seeding. The rake went together with a minimum of trouble, as the holes are just a little tricky to align when inserting the final bolts. This is a sign of accurate drilling of the holes rather than a misalignment, as the rake is solid once it's all together. Weight is good and the width assists with getting a truly smooth and level surface.
customer_reviews.author: Springbok

customer_reviews.title: moves a lot of material quickly.
customer_reviews.text: moves a lot of material quickly. almost like I want a young whipper snapper to use this thing but an old man can still move tons of gravel without exerting too much energy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good for loose dry sand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rake in the hope that it could break up our beach sand which gets compacted from foot traffic and rain and waterfront. It does a fine job on the dry sand, but wet sand it just skims the surface. Does a nice job of skimming debris off the sand and ironically makes a great skimmer for weeds IN the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: This rake has been a great purchase. I use it to gather pine straw ...
customer_reviews.text: This rake has been a great purchase. I use it to gather pine straw from my yard from time to time. I was using a fan rake until a neighbor who had one of these encouraged me to try his. Gets the job done quickly and cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: J. DavidMcGirt

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight rake. Makes pond cleanup SO much easier!
customer_reviews.text: One of my best purchases. I attached a pool noodle and a rope with zip ties to use in my pond to clear floating algae and debris. Very light weight and so easy to throw out into the water. Great quality and better value than a lot of the other floating rakes available. If you need a rake for the same purpose, save yourself a few bucks and purchase this one!
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie

customer_reviews.title: They fixed the problem
customer_reviews.text: We ordered one and the support brace was bent and it had to be returned. I was annoyed but the process was easy and I had the new one in less then a week and it went together fairly easy. It works great to clean out my pond. We get pine needles that blow it and it works great. Seems sturdy I have used it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: tweiler

customer_reviews.title: Bad angle
customer_reviews.text: It’s exactly as described except you don’t know the angle of the teeth are horrible since they don’t get specified or pictured. To get the rake teeth into the ground you almost have to have to pole parallel to the ground! It’s uncomfortable and difficult to get good use out of because of the teeth angle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful quality control made assembly impossible without some rework.
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled the rake is light and sturdy, but the manufacturing quality was extremely poor. The holes were out of alignment making assembly impossible without some rework, and one of the aluminum braces was not the right shape. I had to redrill both holes in the handle in order to get the bolts through, and then bend the bad brace to get the nut onto the longer of the two bolts. The rake part itself has some nasty burrs so I recommend wearing gloves when you are assembling it. .
customer_reviews.author: Garry

customer_reviews.title: Great for leaves under water
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked great for me cleaning leaves out of the water at our beach. I will say it is so light weight though that it is almost a disadvantage. I feel like I have to hold pressure down as I drag. On the flip side being light weight is also nice for overall handling.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: this is not cheap but it works great , I leveled the yard with it no problem , its sturdy and gets the job done. This isn't a rake that you will use a ton , but worth the bucks for sure
customer_reviews.author: sydney shaw

customer_reviews.title: WOW !
customer_reviews.text: After using a standard bow rake this thing is a dream; great for leveling and when used upside down it works as good as a broom on an asphalt driveway. Money well spent !
customer_reviews.author: steve kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Assembly nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Tools required: Hammer (try to smash bolts through overpainted holes) Vise (to smash pole smaller to fit into rake) Sweat rag (bc you will try to muscle this and get pissed) Life is too short to fight this rake....hope the company hires a good mfg engineer soon.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Dog

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this rake.
customer_reviews.text: Solid rake. Well made. American manufacture. I have two large pine trees in my yard, and cleaning up the pine needles and cones out of the lawn is a chore. This rake makes short work of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark52

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a piece of junk. None of the holes aligned to build the rake. It was a simple design, but none of the pieces fit together. The braces were to far off to put together, yes I could have drilled holes to align things, but I didnt pay +50$ to fix a brand new rake. Returned right away, if I wanted a piece of junk I'd go buy one from HD
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I do landscaping for a living and this rake cuts my job in half. It's very light and sturdy covering 40" of ground per pull. It will last forever. VERY HAPPY 😊
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Built like a truck and takes a a beating. Used for leveling and moving solid clay around. Worked great. Built very well and efficient. Get the widest version.
customer_reviews.author: John N

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp and poorly manufactured
customer_reviews.text: Dear Manufacturer: Please deburr the product you send out for the consumer to assemble. Please also do some quality control on the fit-up of the parts to insure a smooth assembly by said consumer. I’m a metal fabricator by trade and the aluminum part of the rake was razor sharp from being machined. It was even able to cut through my battle tested hands. Do some quality control guys!
customer_reviews.author: mike sauter

customer_reviews.title: good landscape rake
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to landscape a newly laid tarred driveway. It was the perfect pitch and easy to use. Not sure on the longevity of it as so far we only needed it for this one project. It is a good buy for us and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn C.

customer_reviews.title: Good rake, poor assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Good rake. Poor assembly. Mine was missing one bolt and the holes did not line up. So, after a trip to the hardware store, and breaking out the electric drill and 1/4” metal bit, I got what I paid for..... a great big rake. To be fair, once assembled it’s a fine product but if you can’t put it together it’s useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight yet sturdy, you can use it all day
customer_reviews.text: I use this when burning tree and bush cuttings to maintain clearance. Lightweight yet sturdy, you can use it all day. This is our second landscape rake. The original is still in use 10 years later.
customer_reviews.author: KVE

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The handle was poorly designed at the connection. The rake portion appeared of quality. For the money, I would buy a commercial grade sand rake.
customer_reviews.author: Muskie52

customer_reviews.title: Well built rake.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to spread 9 yards of compost on the yard. Also to level out the garden after tilling. It works well and still looks like new after all that.
customer_reviews.author: Weekend Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Once over the hurdle of putting this together it’s a great tool!!!
customer_reviews.author: Piper

customer_reviews.title: handle sections are a bit flexible
customer_reviews.text: Other than the amount of bend in the handles, this is great. The hardware includes fiber-lock washers, which are essential. If a nut comes off when the business end of this is on the roof.... Each winter I have to remember to do this first, and then move the snow on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Uhh - the holes do not line up at all.
customer_reviews.text: Just like some of the other reviews on here the holes do not line up. I am currently debating on returning or cutting my losses and drilling new holes. I wouldn't recommend this product since they clearly have a QA issue.
customer_reviews.author: glenn flores

customer_reviews.title: Might be a good rake but poor fit & finish
customer_reviews.text: Quality materials but much harder to assemble than expected. Like many other reviewers noted, the holes don't align well making assembly very difficult and time consuming. I needed a vice, a hammer, a drill and lots of energy to get it all together. I don't recommend for this reason. This company needs a better manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Kline

customer_reviews.title: a dream machine!
customer_reviews.text: A must have tool if you're doing any lawn rebuilding project. Lightweight and extremely sturdy. So glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Hans

customer_reviews.title: Great value Rake
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to get the screws lined up perfectly to get that last step done in the easy-to-follow directions, otherwise I would give it a perfect rating. Great value for the money. We have 2 beaches so I'm using it like crazy. I’m 6’5”, so I would have voted for it to be a 6” - a foot longer
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bendtsen

customer_reviews.title: Troublesome Assembly
customer_reviews.text: While the assembled product is sturdy and functions as advertised, assembling the product was troublesome at best! The predrilled holes did not line up properly requiring redrilling.
customer_reviews.author: MAI

customer_reviews.title: Best rake for making garden rows
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best take I’ve ever owned for building the planting rows in my garden. I was able to build them up in half the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Allport Settle

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a 5 star review if the sharp edges caused by machining were cleaned up, the edges are very sharp. Otherwise it’s very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Pfohler

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is difficult and time consuming.
customer_reviews.text: The holes drilled in the braces ,handle and rake head did not line up and the end of the handle did not fit easily into the slot on the rake head. It required an hour of futzing around in the shop to assemble the rake. I would have sent it back but I needed it right away. So much for the Made in the U S A standard.
customer_reviews.author: J F C T

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Assembly required. That said this is a great quality product. I have raked out a 75x100 ft area that is going to permanent 30 inch wide garden beds. I'm a big boy and not once have I felt like I needed to take it easy on this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey F.

customer_reviews.title: center pole needs to be drilled out to line up
customer_reviews.text: Hole for pole doesn't line up. when tighten bolt over tighten and snapped bolt. Drilled out pole arm and used stainless bolts. Price was best that I could find. Some one else had same problem with holes ,but I am happy with product .works' will
customer_reviews.author: Lou R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rake
customer_reviews.text: I use this rake for my pitching mound. It does exactly what I need it to do and is great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rambo

customer_reviews.title: No thank you
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to use and too heavy to use. I enjoy my yard and garden and this just didn’t work. Way to heavy and hard to manage
customer_reviews.author: Ilsa Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Strong thick tines. Performs as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly required but easy to do. Works beautifully leveling all materials I throw at it from mulch to gravel and sand.
customer_reviews.author: Luke W P Nunn

customer_reviews.title: It will fill a hole but not the one in your heart.
customer_reviews.text: Look closely at this rake. While it may help level the dirt on the ground it may never fill the hole in your heart. Using this product may fulfill an immediate need in your life but it will never fill the void of Barry Bonds not entering the hall of fame. Chew on that buddy...crazy
customer_reviews.author: Brian Staley Pool

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight durable rake
customer_reviews.text: Easy packing with even easier set up. Must buy for landscapers
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Horrible - looks totally Used condition and scratches all over , marks where it was unscrewed , thrown together in an unsealed bag were the nuts / bolts & not even correct amount . Bummer !
customer_reviews.author: emily m.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Best landscaping rake for the money. Well built and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: KRJ

customer_reviews.title: Pricey for poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, but quality control is lacking. Had to drill out one support bracket as it was missing a hole. Not a big deal, but for the price I don’t expect to finish the manufacturers work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle too short.
customer_reviews.text: The rake is a nice, quality built tool. It would be a lot more useful if the handle were longer. I wish there was an option for that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bureau

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but strong
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, just what I needed, should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like this rake. I bought it to spread gravel and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Muzaffer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works great for clearing debris that washes up on the beach.
customer_reviews.author: M.Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great for smoothing gravel or sand
customer_reviews.text: This rake is fantastic for smoothing out gravel and sand. The wide head makes quick work of the space to be smoothed, and the lightweight rake prevents fatigue when working with already heavy materials. I think this rake is great and would highly recommend it for anyone wanting to keep their gravel or sand areas tidy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and wide rakes.
customer_reviews.text: We use these for clearing pine needles in the woods. They have a wide, sturdy path, and are not too heavy. Great purchase. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: T Morris

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Used this lawn rake on 4K sq feet of lawn areas I just completed yesterday. Firm believer any job that includes a new tool is the best way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Cates

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rake
customer_reviews.text: The rake did what was expected made raking the rocks so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel B.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it was designed to do. It is for smoothing broken up soil, not for breaking up sod.
customer_reviews.author: powpowsteve

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required
customer_reviews.text: Very strong rake but no holes drilled in handle for braces and the hole for handle was crooked and had to be redrilled. Tools required. 1/4 in drillbit,square and 1/2 in wrench. 5 star on rake. 1 star on assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: arena rake
customer_reviews.text: Great, well designed, sturdy product at the best price on the market
customer_reviews.author: SteveP

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: Used to remove growth from my pond. Does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: B2

customer_reviews.title: Great rake, sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Missing 1 bolt = 4 stars. Rake is great, sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Nice but couldn't tighten
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, but could not get the screws and nuts in tight enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jan S

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: Due to the width of the rake it cuts down on taking time,
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore Colangelo

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design
customer_reviews.text: The screw holes, and overall design were terrible. I had to drill multiple holes and buy screws to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: The rake was easy to assemble and light weight. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lange

customer_reviews.title: Does what it supposed to, but I wish I ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it supposed to, but I wish I had more talent when coming to leveling ground. I don't have the feel for it and its a lot of work to just go back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: simpleperson

customer_reviews.title: Great rake!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to level gravel , and the yard has a nice length light but sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: A Rake for the Ages
customer_reviews.text: Light-weight rake that is extremely sturdy and gets the job done. I would buy this again but I don't think I will need to. This rake is built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it?
customer_reviews.text: My grown sons want one for xmas. They say it's the best take ever!
customer_reviews.author: PRG

customer_reviews.title: Great price, Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We use to rake the sand around our pier and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Strong and sturdy. I used it for raking several piles of pine needles
customer_reviews.author: sidney smith

customer_reviews.title: The tool works as well as the operator can make it perfor
customer_reviews.text: Quickly put it it together and works awesome for grading out up to 3/4 rock and gravel. Class 5 gravel
customer_reviews.author: Gordo

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to put together. Don't know how I landscaped without this before. Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Shenelle Francis

customer_reviews.title: ... just what we needed to make the produce rows perfect for seeding
customer_reviews.text: This rake is just what we needed to make the produce rows perfect for seeding.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Lughtweight
customer_reviews.text: Like everything about rake except assemble process.Rack needs to be debured -extremely sharp edges
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First Class Lanscape Rake
customer_reviews.text: First class rake. We can't imagine how it could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Penn

customer_reviews.title: Great rake for x beach
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to rake a beach area and keep it free of weeds and it does s great job at that. Well constructed and durable. I would highly recommend this rake
customer_reviews.author: GIFF

customer_reviews.title: Great rake.
customer_reviews.text: Great rake ..we use it to clean the bottom of our pond that has a gravel bottom ...good quality ..
customer_reviews.author: Rick500

customer_reviews.title: works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought for leveling pea gravel, works better than I expected. Build quality is good but the holes in the handle didn't line up perfectly with the rake head. Managed to "fix" the alignment with a hammer so I didn't need to get the drill out.
customer_reviews.author: N. Dencklau

customer_reviews.title: Would give it 5 stars but the sides of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Would give it 5 stars but the sides of the tines were very sharp. Filed them after getting a finger cut.They need to add one step to their manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, works as expected. I used it when I re-sod my yard.
customer_reviews.author: goodyear

customer_reviews.title: Great Rake!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for preparing ground for a new lawn and leveling out large areas.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum Landscape Rake
customer_reviews.text: Nice rake for the money! Lightweight - easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: sas

customer_reviews.title: Good rake - for limited purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rake for use on a beach and to take aquatic weeds. It works well, is light and strong. But I don't like the shape of the teeth at the tips - like little hooks that make it hard to remove the weeds from the rake.
customer_reviews.author: Ploni

customer_reviews.title: Great Landscape Rake
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Midwest Landscape Rake for a couple of months now and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrdwe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The ease of putting together. Lightweight and performs as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great rake
customer_reviews.text: This does just what I wanted it to and it is a quality product. I use it for raking out a fine gravel yard.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice rack however I was hoping it wasn’t as light ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice rack however I was hoping it wasn’t as light weight. I had to dig harder in order to level well. Easier projects with just soil should work great; If you have a tougher job with rocks and dry soil buy something more heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Shipping was fast and the price was good too. would truely reccomend tis product to anyone looking for a good landscape rake.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Algae eater!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing out there to rake algae from pond! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mid Mich Bob

customer_reviews.title: Delivery disatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Product was fine however our mail is on a busy highway and item was left on the road but brought to the home an it is a sunday delivery not happy
customer_reviews.author: Garden rake

customer_reviews.title: The brackets that attach the handle/pole to the rack itself ...
customer_reviews.text: The brackets that attach the handle/pole to the rack itself were not sized correctly. I had to use a metal drill bit and drill my own hole to get the brackets attached. Cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great help
customer_reviews.text: I used it to level new 1" gravel dumped in my driveway. It was very helpful to level and drag to material around. You have to be able to press down to grab the material, as it is to light to grab much material by it's own weight.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley E. Suppanz

product_meta.title: Midwest 10036 Aluminum Landscape Rake, 36-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:36-InchIt has a solid alumum plug in the head to handle conection; meares 66-inch length by 46-inch width by 4-inch height
feature_bullets: Features long, rounded teeth provide a smooth, non gouging raking action, while its striking edge is excellent for grading
